S. Korean Opposition Party Vows Anti-war Movement 
    Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- Members of the Democratic Workers' Party of south Korea reportedly made public a "declaration for peace in Phyongthaek" on Apr. 5.
 In the declaration they said that the relocation of the U.S. forces, in south Korea and the agreement on the "strategic flexibility" seriously threaten peace of the Korean Peninsula and that they would conduct an active movement for peace against war to check them.    
 They stressed that they would mobilize all means to defend precious cultural assets, environmental conditions, eco-system and others in Phyongthaek from destruction by the expansion of the U.S. military base.

Holidays of DPRK Marked in Different Countries 
    Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- The Day of the Sun and the 13th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission were commemorated in different countries. A Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibition was opened in Bulgaria and film shows, round-table talks and lectures held in the Czech Republic, Tanzania and Uganda in the period from March 30 to April 4.
 On display at the exhibition were works of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and photos showing their undying feats, books introducing Korea, and handicraft works associated with the Korean nation's wisdom and talents. 
 The director of the Sofia City Cultural Institute said at its opening ceremony that the Bulgarian people would have a better understanding of Korea through the exhibition. He wished the Korean people big success in their efforts for the prosperity and reunification of the country.    
 The chairman of the Kutna Hora County Committee of the Communist Party of Bohemia and Moravia said that the film show brought home to him the might of the Korean People's Army and the source of the invincibility of the DPRK and hardened his belief that nobody in the world can match such army and people.
 The secretary general of the Tanzanian National Coordinating Committee of the Juche Idea Study Groups noted in a lecture that the might of the Songun politics has been fully displayed in the DPRK mainly because it is the perfect socialist political mode fully supported by all the Korean people. Socialist Korea will make a long drive under the banner of Songun, he said.

Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Pakistan
    Pyongyang, April 8 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's famous work "Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully through the Great Unity of the Entire Nation" was brought out in booklet by the Victorial Publishing House of Pakistan on April 3.
 The work published on April 18, Juche 87 (1998), clarified the five-point policy of great unity of the whole nation which call on all Koreans to unite on the principle of national independence under the banner of patriotism and national reunification, improve the north-south relations, struggle against foreign domination and interference and the anti-reunification forces, develop mutual visits, contacts and dialogue and consolidate solidarity and alliance.

Special Bulletin Released in Nepal
    Pyongyang, April 8 (KCNA) -- The Nepal-Korea Friendship Association released a special bulletin titled "Great Politician, Great Brilliant Commander Kim Jong Il" on Mar. 31 on the occasion of the 13th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
 The bulletin said that Kim Jong Il, endowed with personality and qualifications as an outstanding brilliant commander, has pursued the Songun politics, protecting the destiny of the country and the people and developing the DPRK.
 The DPRK has given top priority to the national defence, frustrating the moves of the imperialist allied forces to isolate and stifle it and defending socialism by dint of single-minded unity and strong military power, it added.

articles.content:
New Book Sees Light
    Pyongyang, April 8 (KCNA) -- The book "Collection of Revolutionary History of Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" Vol. 9 edited by the History Institute of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea was published by the Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House.
 The book has three parts and an appendix. It deals with materials on the revolutionary activities of Kim Il Sung from February to October of Juche 25 (1936).
 The first part of the book carries his reminiscences telling how he laid down a new strategic policy to bring about a great upswing in the overall Korean revolution centered on the anti-Japanese armed struggle and led the struggle to strengthen the main force of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army (KPRA), found the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland and establish a base in Mt. Paektu.
 The second part of the book carries reminiscences of commanding officers and soldiers of the KPRA and members of the revolutionary organizations telling about the revolutionary activities conducted by Kim Il Sung while advancing into the area of Mt. Paektu from Xiaojiazhihe pursuant to the policy laid down at the Nanhutou Meeting.
 The third part of the book deals with facts about his revolutionary activities from February to October of Juche 25 (1936).

Commemorative Stamp Published
    Pyongyang, April 8 (KCNA) -- A commemorative stamp (a kind of stamp) was issued in the DPRK to mark the Day of the Sun (April 15).
 Printed on the upper part of the stamp are words "In commemoration of the great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's birthday", "April 15" and "The Day of the Sun" and reflected in its centre are Kimilsungias in full bloom.    
 The greatness of President Kim Il Sung is illustrated with the Sun's flower which blooms in different parts of the world in reflection of the boundless reverence of the Korean people and the world revolutionary people for him.
 The face value of the stamp is 3 won.

articles.content:
Preemptive Attack not Monopoly of U.S., Warns Kim Il Chol
    Pyongyang, April 8 (KCNA) -- A preemptive attack is not monopoly of the U.S. and the DPRK will never sit idle till it is exposed to a preemptive attack of the U.S., warned Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Il Chol, member of the DPRK National Defence Commission and minister of the People's Armed Forces.
 This warning came from his report at a national meeting held at the April 25 House of Culture here on Saturday to mark the 13th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as NDC chairman.    
 The situation is growing tenser and more acute on the Korean Peninsula than ever before due to the U.S. ever-more undisguised hostile policy toward the DPRK and its reckless military provocations, he said, and continued:    
 The U.S. is now talking about the six-party talks but in fact, it is zealously inciting hostility toward the DPRK while floating all sorts of sheer fictions, utterly indifferent to the talks. It is only watching for every chance to attack the DPRK while staging large-scale war exercises after listing it as a target of "preemptive attack."
 It is the traditional combat method of the DPRK to directly counter the pressure and threat of aggression from the enemies, without yielding to them. 
 The army and people of the DPRK will closely follow the every move of the U.S. with high revolutionary vigilance. Should the U.S. ignite a war of aggression at any cost, they will mobilize their politico-ideological might and military potentials built up generation after generation under the leadership of the great illustrious Songun commander and mercilessly wipe out the enemies and thus victoriously conclude the stand-off with the U.S.
